headline: Samsung TriFold, MongoDB, Beyond Meat: Trending stocks
summary: Samsung (005930.KS) makes a statement with its new Galaxy Z TriFold smartphone ahead of Apple's (AAPL) expected launch of a foldable model. MongoDB (MDB) Atlas boosts earnings and lifts shares. Marvell (MRVL) Technology is reportedly close to reaching a deal to acquire Celestial AI. Costco (COST) joins the wave of retailers seeking a refund if courts strike down Trump's emergency tariffs. And Beyond Meat (BYND) is on the rise again. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Costco Is Suing the Trump Administration—Here's Why
summary: Warehouse retail giant Costco Wholesale has sued the Trump administration as it seeks a refund for the tariffs it has paid as the Supreme Court considers whether they were enacted illegally.

content.title: Costco Is Suing the Trump Administration—Here's Why

thumbnail.caption: Kevin Carter / Getty Images Costco is looking to get a refund on the tariffs it has paid so far under the Trump administration's tariffs

headline: Costco becomes biggest company yet to demand refund of Trump tariffs
summary: Costco is joining other companies that aren't waiting to see whether the Supreme Court strikes down President Donald Trump's most sweeping import taxes.  The U.S. Court of International Trade and the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington ruled earlier this year that Trump's biggest and boldest import taxes are illegal.  The case is now before the Supreme Court.

content.title: Costco becomes biggest company yet to demand refund of Trump tariffs
content.summary: Costco is joining other companies that aren't waiting to see whether the Supreme Court strikes down President Donald Trump's most sweeping import taxes.  The U.S. Court of International Trade and the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington ruled earlier this year that Trump's biggest and boldest import taxes are illegal.  The case is now before the Supreme Court.

headline: Costco sues Trump administration to pause tariffs, refund payments
summary: The discount retailer, a big importer, wants the U.S. government to stop imposing tariffs until the Supreme Court weighs in on the legality of Trump's executive orders.

content.title: Costco sues Trump administration to pause tariffs, refund payments
content.summary: The discount retailer, a big importer, wants the U.S. government to stop imposing tariffs until the Supreme Court weighs in on the legality of Trump's executive orders.

thumbnail.caption: Although hundreds of customers lined up on three sides of the Costco building before doors opened, most looking for water, toilet paper, paper towels and cleaning supplies, there were plenty of shopping carts in Burbank on Friday, March 13, 2020. A continual flow of single-file customers entered the store for thirty-minutes although more customers continued to arrive throughout the morning. Water and other necessities were out of stock within 20 minutes after the store opened. According to a manager on site who did not give his name, an entire truckload of water was scooped up by customers in less than half an hour.

headline: Costco to Seek Refunds if Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump Tariffs
summary: Costco became the latest and one of the biggest companies to sue the Trump administration over tariffs in an effort to secure a full refund should the Supreme Court rule the sweeping duties illegal.  In a filing with the U.S. Court of International Trade on Friday, Costco said the lawsuit is necessary to make sure it is eligible for refunds if the Supreme Court rejects the administration’s reasons for tariffs collected under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.  Others have also filed similar lawsuits against the Trump administration, including Revlon Consumer Products, Bumble Bee Foods and Kawasaki Motors Manufacturing, as well as a number of Democratic-led states and politicians.

content.title: Costco to Seek Refunds if Supreme Court Strikes Down Trump Tariffs
content.summary: Costco became the latest and one of the biggest companies to sue the Trump administration over tariffs in an effort to secure a full refund should the Supreme Court rule the sweeping duties illegal.  In a filing with the U.S. Court of International Trade on Friday, Costco said the lawsuit is necessary to make sure it is eligible for refunds if the Supreme Court rejects the administration’s reasons for tariffs collected under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act.  Others have also filed similar lawsuits against the Trump administration, including Revlon Consumer Products, Bumble Bee Foods and Kawasaki Motors Manufacturing, as well as a number of Democratic-led states and politicians.

headline: Why Costco is suing the Trump administration
summary: Costco just broke ranks with the majority of corporate America, suing the Trump administration on Friday for allegedly overstepping its authority to impose sweeping tariffs this year — and demanding its money back if the Supreme Court ultimately strikes them down.

content.title: Why Costco is suing the Trump administration
content.summary: Costco just broke ranks with the majority of corporate America, suing the Trump administration on Friday for allegedly overstepping its authority to impose sweeping tariffs this year — and demanding its money back if the Supreme Court ultimately strikes them down.

thumbnail.caption: A woman shops for items at a Costco store on April 28 in Alhambra, California. - Frederic J. Brown/AFP/Getty Images
